intro: Premna dallachyana, commonly known as the Indian nettle or velvetleaf. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Verbenaceae, characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pink in color. It is native to regions of Asia, including India, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Premna dallachyana is often found in forests and along stream banks, where it plays a role in maintaining local biodiversity.
